meanings.definition: Having or showing an excessively high opinion of oneself
meanings.sent1: She is so conceited that she believes she is better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: He comes across as conceited because he always talks about how amazing he is.
meanings.sent3: The conceited cat strutted around the house as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The conceited sun thought it was the most important star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The conceited peacock flaunted its feathers to impress the other birds.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an exaggerated sense of self-importance
meanings.sent1: The conceited actor refused to talk to anyone below his perceived status.
meanings.sent2: Her conceited behavior made it difficult for others to approach her.
meanings.sent3: The conceited squirrel believed it was the ruler of the entire park.
meanings.sent4: The conceited mountain stood tall, looking down on the surrounding landscape.
meanings.sent5: The conceited flower demanded all the attention in the garden.

meanings.sent1: He was so conceited that he never acknowledged the hard work of others.
meanings.sent2: The conceited student thought he was too good for the rest of the class.
meanings.sent3: The conceited tree refused to bend even in the strongest winds.
meanings.sent4: The conceited lion roared loudly to assert its dominance over the pride.
meanings.sent5: The conceited cloud blocked the sun, thinking it was more important.
